Upgrade.name: Fundamental Skin Science
Upgrade.flavor:
The skin of any organism can be transmuted into bronze by soaking it with water and then wringing it in a 41-43 degrees celcius enviromnent for 399 seconds.

+1 Bronze for every kill

Upgrade.name: Blood Spear Fishing
Upgrade.flavor:
Out of the approximately 2791741.5 species of fish (Yes... there are several half-fishes), thousands of them are attracted to blood. Blood is good bait but it can be dangerous to have carnivorous animals know where you are. Blood Spear Fishing' is like a fishing-martial-art that makes using Blood safe in fishing.

Doubles Spearman Idle Revenue

Upgrade.name: Whetfish Ichthyology
Upgrade.flavor:
The Whetfish is a very common species, many can find it... few can use it. The magical scales and saliva of the fish can either harden solids or empower other magical sources. As you can already tell it is used to make weapons stronger ,hence its name which is derived from the 'whetstone' (And yes... the picture in the icon is an annotated Diagram of the fish).

+1 Attack for all Weapons

Upgrade.name: Blood Spear Fishing II
Upgrade.flavor:
More training means more skill, more skill allows more blood, more blood means more fish.

Doubles Spearman Idle Revenue

Upgrade.name: Swordsman Tracking
Upgrade.flavor:
Unlike Knights, Generic Swordsman are not trained how to track game. They are instead trained for armed combat. Coming from mediocre comes with the restriction of only having the liberty of learning one trade. In this case direct combat.

Doubles Swordsman Idle Revenue

Upgrade.name: Early Desensitization
Upgrade.flavor:
Knights are inherently sensitive to killing innocent creatures, this blatantly pointless world view prevents them from reaching their full hunting potential. A decrease in hesistance and increase in production can be achieved the ridding of this mental barrier is worked on.

Doubles Knight Idle Revenue

Upgrade.name: Goblin Metallurgy
Upgrade.flavor:
The integration of Goblin Metallurgy in the armor of your own army can be useful. Remember... Good people learn from their mistakes, great people learn from their enemies.

+1 Armor for your entire army

Upgrade.name: Arcane Static Dampening
Upgrade.flavor:
I am gonna spare you the technical jargon. Basically "static" refers to how a trap is stationary, "Arcane" means it is an Arcane Trap in question. (You don't have to know what Dampening is, just knows that it makes the spell more potent).

Doubles Arcane Trap damage

Upgrade.name: Heightened Smell
Upgrade.flavor:
Improving Smell will provide these bears with more hunting ability. And reduce sinus infections.

Doubles Trained Bear Idle Revenue

Upgrade.name: Bait Lotion
Upgrade.flavor:
They will put the lotion on the skin, or else they get the hose again.

Doubles Reanimated Corpse Idle Revenue

Upgrade.name: Giant Net
Upgrade.flavor:
Giant Nets will help in capturing giant animals.

Doubles Giant Idle Revenue

Upgrade.name: Arcane Alpha Condensation
Upgrade.flavor:
The first step towards 100% trap perfection

Quadruples Arcane Trap Damage

Upgrade.name: Educated Swordsmen
Upgrade.flavor:
Education is always good, especially for the ones who lack it.

Doubles Swordsmen Idle Revenue

Upgrade.name: Medium Desensitization
Upgrade.flavor:
Getting Closer...

Doubles Knight Idle Revenue

Upgrade.name: Heightened Smell II
Upgrade.flavor:
I can smell my house from here!

Doubles Trained Bear Idle Revenue

Upgrade.name: Compound Bait
Upgrade.flavor:
A mixture of bait on the lotion will result in a mixture of prey being attracted

Doubles Reanimated Corpse Idle Revenue

Upgrade.name: Spider Maps
Upgrade.flavor:
Maps made up of willowsilk spider silk are flexible enough for a giant not to accidentally rip it, Giants would benefit well from maps. As they can now traverse areas with higher-yielding creatures to rake in more dough.

Doubles Giant Idle Revenue

Upgrade.name: Arcane Army Amplification
Upgrade.flavor: Doubles Attack and Health of all Mercenaries

Foe.name: Generic Goblin
Foe.flavor: Generic Goblins are normally passive and weak. These guys are an ideal first enemy.

Foe.name: Generic Imp
Foe.flavor: Generic Imps are far stronger than the average man, Fun Fact: A Generic Imp on average can benchpress 2.32 tonnes. However for all their superior strength, they can be overcome by an organized number of hunters.

Foe.name: Generic Snake
Foe.flavor: These Snakes have a sturdy carpace capable of withstanding sharp Iron weapons without a scratch. It is important to fight these creatures using blunt force when you have low-grade equipment. As sharp weapons weapons of low-grade will do no harm to them.

Foe.name: Killer Goblin Novice
Foe.flavor: These creatures survive through eating other weaker species of goblins. And sometimes cannibalism.

Foe.name: Frosty Abomination Fourth Class
Foe.flavor: A cruel manifestation of arcane malevolence. Though this one is but a shade.

Foe.name: Blue Imp
Foe.flavor: Blue Imps are stronger than their Generic counterparts. Their blue skin is as durable as diamond.

Foe.name: Regular Witch
Foe.flavor: A dabbler in the Arcane, still dangerous even though inexperienced.

Foe.name: Poisonous Snake
Foe.flavor: These snakes have evolved to combat bigger enemies with their poisonous bite and their tough scales.

Foe.name: Murderer Reaver
Foe.flavor: Reavers are the mangled and corrupt souls of the recently dead, Their most dangerous ability is their lifesteal capabilty.

Foe.name: Treasure Chest (Basic)
Foe.flavor: A Treasure Chest! What could be inside?

Foe.name: Flame Witch
Foe.flavor: A Witch that dabbles specifically in fire magic, a very destructive element. Fire magic typically affects a large area and can deal a lot of damage in the long run if left unchecked.

Foe.name: Dreadshroom
Foe.flavor: A Basic skill of anyone who studies disease magic is to summon Dreadshrooms. Mushrooms that emit a deadly poison 5.2x more potent than Botchulinum.

Foe.name: Fungalmancer
Foe.flavor: Someone who indulges in a specific subset of Disease Magic, Fungalmancy. The ability to manipulate,create and spread disease-ridden fungi.

Foe.name: Novice Witch
Foe.flavor: These witches are not mere dabblers. They are practitioners to the higher mysteries of the Arcane.

Foe.name: Chaotic Flesh
Foe.flavor: A Witch that specializes in fire magic, a very destructive element. Fire magic typically affects a large area and can deal a lot of damage in the long run if left unchecked.

Foe.name: Regular Deathspawn
Foe.flavor: Spawns formed using the remains of the dead. created by Practioners of Death Magic.

Foe.name: Death Knight
Foe.flavor: Servants of Necromancers, corpses imbued with Death Magic. Capable of manipulating and raising the dead themselves and leech life.

Foe.name: The Petty Essence of Unknown
Foe.flavor: The first Essence of the unknown, weak but deadly. It can become intangible and has enough power to destroy a large island with ease. Be careful when approaching this being.

Foe.name: Novice Paladin
Foe.flavor: Servants of the Light, this one is a mere novice. Not blessed by holy magic yet.

Foe.name: Novice Healer
Foe.flavor: Defenseless in combat, but still useful nonetheless. Healers work to... (Insert Self-Explanatory clause here).

Foe.name: Summoner Alpha Class
Foe.flavor: These foes summon random minions. Make sure to kill them quickly before they get good RNG and summon something dangerous.

Foe.name: Minor Cryomancer
Foe.flavor: Cryomancers - Serious students of Ice Magic, these Minor Cryomancers have Undergraduate degrees in Cryomancy. They can dish out a lot of damage and apply a freezing effect on you and your army.

Foe.name: Ninja of Shade
Foe.flavor: Contrary to popular culture, Ninjas started out as discount assassins... Lower class warriors of irregular warfare originating in a country where the honorable culture made shady tactics like espionage and sabotage was frowned upon.

Foe.name: Petty Necromancer
Foe.flavor: Speakers for the Dead, able to raise servants in the form of Death Knights.

Foe.name: Chronomancer of Nanoseconds
Foe.flavor: Chronomancy - Magic of time. To learn Chronomancy at any magic school you have to get an A+ in General and Special Relativity.
